data: Those who like a “white Christmas” should see one out on the Western plains, where old Mother Earth lies down for her winter sleep under a coverlet so white that from horizon to horizon there is hardly enough gray to outline her form.
Stanley, Caroline Abbot, 1849-1919; Hoskins, Gayle Porter, 1887-1962 [Illustrator]
